test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify all products have valid category_id
test_scenarios.description: This scenario is to ensure that all products in the products table have a valid category_id that exists in the categories table
test_scenarios.test_scenario: Check if any product has a category_id that does not exist in the categories table
test_scenarios.test_query: SELECT CASE WHEN EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM [dbo].[products] WHERE [category_id] NOT IN (SELECT [id] FROM [dbo].[categories])) THEN 0 ELSE 1 END
validation_criteria: If the query returns 1, the test passes. If the query returns 0, the test fails.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify no product has NULL category_id
test_scenarios.description: This scenario is to ensure that there are no products in the products table with NULL category_id
test_scenarios.test_scenario: Check if any product has a NULL category_id
test_scenarios.test_query: SELECT CASE WHEN EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM [dbo].[products] WHERE [category_id] IS NULL) THEN 0 ELSE 1 END
validation_criteria: If the query returns 1, the test passes. If the query returns 0, the test fails.

test_scenarios.description: This scenario is to ensure that there are no orphan records in the products table i.e., products that do not belong to any category
test_scenarios.test_scenario: Check if any product does not belong to any category
test_scenarios.test_query: SELECT CASE WHEN EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM [dbo].[products] WHERE [category_id] NOT IN (SELECT [id] FROM [dbo].[categories])) THEN 0 ELSE 1 END
validation_criteria: If the query returns 1, the test passes. If the query returns 0, the test fails.
